data.LLMprompt: Make a p-type differential pair. Parametrize everything.
Make a current mirror using common centroid placement technique. you can place a common centroid component

place two current mirrors components, one called top and the other called bottom. Route the source of top's reference transistor to the drain of bottom's mirror transistor. Route the source of top's mirror transistor to the drain of the bottoms reference transistor
create a 2 by 3 mimcap array. Only parametrize the size of the mimcaps.
Place two push pulls and two interdigitated pairs, one a pair of pfets called source and the other a pair of nfets called sink. Route from drain of source_A to drain of sink_A

place two interdigitated component (one pmos pair called top and one nmos pair caled bottom). Move bottom below top. route the A  transistors of top and bottom as a push pull an same for the B transistors (sources shorted and gates shorted). Then place two pmos transistors mirror and reference above top (move mirror to the right of reference). Place two nmos transistrplace two interdigitated pairs (one pmos pair called top and one nmos pair caled bottom). Move bottom below top. route the A  transistors of top and bottom as a push pull an same for the B transistors (sources shorted and gates shorted). Then place two pmos transistors called p_mirr and p_ref above top (p_mirr should be to the right of p_ref). Similarly place two nmos transistors alled n_mirr and n_ref below bottom and move them. short the gates of n_ref and n_mirr and theirsources. do the same for p_ref and p_mirr. route the gate of n_ref to drain of the B transistor' drain of bottom. similarly route the gate of p_ref to the drain of the B transistor of top

A strong arm latch consists of a diffpair, a CrossCoupleInverters, a bridge nfet, a clkgnd nfet, and two pfets clkpwrL (west) and clkpwrR (east). The cross coupled inverters should be at the top. The bridge should be above the diffpair but below the cross coupled inverters. The clkgnd should be at the bottom, and both clkpwr transistors should be left and right of the cross coupled inverters. You must route the drain of transistor A of the diffpair with the drain of the bridge, the drain of transistor B of the diffpair with the source of the bridge, the source of transistor A in the diffpair with the source of clkgnd.
Create a delta sigma modulator. This combines several different components including an opamp and a latched comparator. The latched comparator can be imported
